headline: Strong Q3 Earnings and DOT-T-Mobile 5G Contract Might Change The Case For Investing In Iridium (IRDM)
summary: Iridium Communications reported third-quarter 2025 earnings surpassing analyst expectations, with revenue of US$226.94 million and net income of US$37.13 million, while also announcing a contract with the U.S. Department of Transportation to deploy Positioning, Navigation, and Timing services nationwide in partnership with T-Mobile. This combination of robust financial results and the expansion into critical 5G infrastructure through government collaboration highlights Iridium's positioning...

This combination of robust financial results and the expansion into critical 5G infrastructure through government collaboration highlights Iridium's positioning...

headline: T-Mobile's incoming CEO: AT&T is taking potshots because it's 'under pressure'
summary: Incoming T-Mobile chief Srini Gopalan fires back at AT&T while touting transparency, growth, and future acquisitions.

raw.headline: T-Mobile's incoming CEO: AT&T is taking potshots because it's 'under pressure'

headline: T-Mobile incoming CEO: 'We're open to fiber acquisitions'
summary: T-Mobile (TMUS) COO Srini Gopalan, who will become the company's CEO on Nov. 1, sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi to discuss his priorities when taking the helm and more. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Morning Movers: Tesla, IBM slipping following quarterly reports
summary: Stock futures were modestly lower as disappointing quarterly results from major tech names weighed on sentiment. Markets look set to open with a muted tone, reflecting a mix of elevated risk and uncertainty. Oil surged nearly 4% after the U.S. imposed fresh sanctions on Russia’s top oil companies, creating a shockwave across energy markets and raising inflation concerns. Concurrently, the dollar firmed against major currencies ahead of a delayed U.S. consumer-price report, while the yen weakened

headline: T-Mobile (TMUS) Margin Gains Reinforce Bullish Narratives Despite Premium Valuation and Cautious Outlook
summary: T-Mobile US (TMUS) posted net profit margins of 14.5%, up from 12% last year, with earnings growing 29.2% in the most recent period. Over the past five years, the company’s earnings have expanded at an impressive 38.6% annual rate. However, growth is now forecast to moderate to 14.95% annually, with revenue expected to rise 4.8% per year, trailing the broader US market’s 10% growth rate. With shares trading below estimated fair value and analyst targets, yet the price-to-earnings ratio at...

headline: T-Mobile Raises Outlook, So Why Is Wall Street Selling?

headline: Big Tech is paying for Trump’s White House ballroom
summary: Trump's $250 million White House ballroom will be funded in part by big tech companies like Amazon, Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft.
